business.headline: Sensex jumps over 700 points: Why is stock market rising todayAs of 9:22 am, the S&P BSE Sensex was up 593.08 points at 82,502.71. The NSE Nifty50 climbed 182.95 points to 25,340.45. The strong opening showed that investors were willing to take fresh positions after recent uncertainty.
Sensex jumps 550 points, Nifty above 25,300; Eternal up 6%Sensex jumps 550 points, Nifty above 25,300; Eternal up 6%

Sensex, Nifty today: Stock market likely to open higher. Here's whyGIFT Nifty futures were trading at 25,338 at around 8:09 AM. This points to a positive opening for the Nifty 50, which closed at 25,157.50 on Wednesday.

Movie isn't over: Gita Gopinath on Trump tariffs and Carney's speechGita Gopinath, Indian-American economist and Professor of Economics at Harvard University, shares her insights on Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney's remarks on shifting global economic order during the World Economic Forum in Davos and dealing with tariffs.

Pollution a bigger economic threat than tariffs for India, says Gita GopinathGopinath said discussions about new business development often focus on trade, tariffs and regulations, but pollution is rarely given the importance it deserves.

WEF Roundtable: Can India become the third-largest economy? Experts weigh inAt World Economic Forum (WEF) Roundtable in Davos, India Today Group Vice-Chairperson and Executive Editor-in-Chief Kalli Purie moderated a session on India's growth story.

India has emerged as trusted value chain partner to the world: Ashwini VaishnawUnion Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw said the biggest change over the last decade has been how the world views India's role in global manufacturing.

Can India become the world's third-largest economy?At Davos, a session moderated by India Today Group Vice-Chairperson and Executive Editor-in-Chief Kalli Purie brought together leading economist Gita Gopinath, Union Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw, Bharti Chairman Sunil Bharti Mittal, and IKEA Group CEO Juvencio Maeztu Herrera to decode India's journey towards becoming the world's third-largest economy.

Markets will fall and bounce back, says Gita Gopinath on uncertain global outlookGopinath said she had earlier believed the world had passed the peak of tariff tensions by 2025. However, developments at the start of 2026, including tensions over Greenland and a visible rupture between the US and the European Union, changed that view.

An Autumn Davos in India? Ashwini Vaishnaw flags new idea at WEFUnderscoring the growing global recognition of India's economic reforms and investment momentum, Union Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw pitched for an 'Autumn Davos' at the World Economic Forum (WEF).

Sensex, Nifty extend losses a day after sharp sell-off; rupee hits record lowThe Nifty 50 closed 0.3% lower at 25,157.5, while the BSE Sensex slipped 0.33% to settle at 81,909.63. Both indices touched fresh three-month lows during the day. In the previous session, the Nifty had fallen 1.4% and the Sensex had dropped 1.3%.

Zomato's Deepinder Goyal steps down as Eternal CEO, Albinder Dhindsa to take overThe online delivery firm, which runs food delivery platform Zomato and quick commerce arm Blinkit, reported a sequential increase in profit for the third quarter, driven by strong demand for quick-delivery services.

India's AI push puts it on path to global tech powerhouse, says Ashwini VaishnawThe Union Minister said AI is now being used almost everywhere, making it essential for countries to build capabilities across all layers of the technology.

Why EU-India FTA will be Mother of All Deals, and Trump deserves a thanksAfter almost two decades of work and negotiations, the India-EU Free Trade Agreement (FTA) is the closest it has ever been to fruition. The deal would not only benefit both sides enormously, but also come as a rude awakening for US President Donald Trump.

RIL shares face January blues, trade at 5-year oversold levels. Should you buy?RIL share price: The country's most valuable listed company with a market value of close to $210 billion, has seen its shares slide sharply since the start of the year.

Gold hits record Rs 1.57 lakh: Is it time to buy, hold or sell?Gold has touched a new peak of Rs 1.57 lakh, fuelled by rising geopolitical tensions and safe-haven demand. As the rally gathers pace, the key question for investors is whether to enter now or wait for a pullback.

AI, trade risks and growth: Why India still stands out for global investorsAnanya Birla, Director at the Aditya Birla Group, spoke about trade disruptions and tariffs, saying short-term volatility cannot be ignored. However, she said long-term investors continue to see India as a stable and high-growth market.

EPFO 3.0 coming soon: New platform, core banking system and regional language supportThe Employees' Provident Fund Organisation (EPFO) is preparing for its next major digital upgrade, EPFO 3.0. The move aims to make PF services faster, more user-friendly and accessible to workers across both organised and unorganised sectors.

Kalyan Jewellers share price tumbles 12%: Why is the stock falling today?While the broader market was weak, the depth of the fall pointed to a mix of technical stress, institutional activity and sector-specific caution.

Rupee slides past 91 per US dollar: What is driving the fall?The sharp slide came as global uncertainty rose once again. Investors worldwide have been shifting money toward safer assets, which has strengthened the US dollar and put pressure on emerging market currencies.

entertainment.headline: Aamir Khan says he is already married to Gauri Spratt as they move in together Aamir Khan and Gauri Spratt, who have been in a relationship for some time, have reportedly moved into a new home in Mumbai. Khan recently opened up about their relationship and said how he is already married to her in his heart.

Success streak of Anil Ravipudi: What connects his films with audiences? With a decade-long hit streak and a clear understanding of family audiences, Anil Ravipudi continues to succeed by prioritising entertainment over online noise.

Cruz Beckham likes meme mocking Victoria's inappropriate dance at Brooklyn's wedding Cruz Beckham has drawn attention by liking a meme on social media that pokes fun at Victoria Beckham's dance moves at Brooklyn Beckham's 2022 wedding. The post comes just days after Brooklyn publicly criticised his mother, intensifying the ongoing family feud.

Sony executives call Blake Lively terrorist, slam haircare launch amid legal row Sony Pictures privately criticised Blake Lively during the It Ends With Us controversy, with internal emails showing executives questioning her future in Hollywood. The dispute has since moved to court, with claims of financial losses set to be examined at the May 18 trial.

Vishal Bhardwaj addresses Shahid rift rumours: I'm a difficult person to work with Director Vishal Bhardwaj has responded to longstanding rumours regarding a fallout with actor Shahid Kapoor, clarifying their professional relationship during the trailer launch of his upcoming film 'O'Romeo'.

Taylor Swift, Blake Lively's private texts expose friendship rift in Baldoni lawsuit Newly revealed private messages showed Taylor Swift and Blake Lively openly discussing changes in their friendship during the production of It Ends with Us and amid director Justin Baldoni's ongoing legal dispute with Lively.

Masters of the Universe teaser: Nicholas Galitzine thrills fans with 80s nostalgia Amazon and MGM Studios have unveiled the first teaser for their upcoming live-action 'Masters of the Universe' film, aiming to evoke nostalgia among Generation X with familiar visuals and cast announcements.

Censor poser: Why Dhurandhar 2 teaser needed certification but Toxic did not Ranveer Singh's Dhurandhar 2 teaser was censored with an A certificate for theatrical screening, while Yash's Toxic teaser on YouTube was not. This brings back the old debate over the differing rules for cinema and digital platforms, and the effectiveness of censorship.

Zayn Malik performs unreleased songs at Las Vegas residency, hints at new record Zayn Malik launched his seven-show Las Vegas residency on January 20 at Dolby Live at Park MGM, marking his first solo tour in the city. The singer performed a mix of hits, rare tracks, and four unreleased songs while recovering from illness.

Travis Scott addresses Astroworld tragedy, shares efforts to aid Houston's recovery In a recent interview, Travis Scott discussed his hopes to support healing in Houston following the 2021 Astroworld Festival tragedy. The rapper emphasised the personal and professional effects of the event and clarified his perspective.

Harry Styles announces new single Aperture from next album. Check details Harry Styles has revealed that his new single 'Aperture' will debut on January 23 at 7 pm ET, marking the first official release from his anticipated fourth album 'Kiss All the Time. Disco, Occasionally.'

Taylor Swift joins Songwriters Hall of Fame as one of its youngest members ever Taylor Swift has been inducted into the Songwriters Hall of Fame as one of its youngest members in history. The 36-year-old submitted All Too Well (10 Minute Version), Blank Space, Anti-Hero, Love Story and The Last Great American Dynasty for her successful nomination.

BTS plans a free comeback performance at South Korea's historic Gwanghwamun Square BTS is planning a 'free' comeback performance at South Korea's historic Gwanghwamun Square. The first solo concert will link BTS to Korean heritage.

Sanjay Leela Bhansali to represent Indian cinema at Republic Day parade: Report Sanjay Leela Bhansali, in a first-ever, will represent Indian cinema at the 2026 Republic Day parade. He will present a special tableau at Kartavya Path on January 26, 2026.

Tamannaah Bhatia, Vishal team up again for Sundar C's next, title teaser out Vishal and director Sundar C have teamed up for the fourth time, officially announcing their new film Purushan. The title reveal teaser introduces Tamannaah as the female lead, with Yogi Babu featuring in a supporting role.

Mayasabha trailer: Jaaved Jaaferi's film is a dark tale of greed and missing gold The trailer of Jaaved Jaaferi's psychological-thriller Mayasabha was released on January 21, 2026. The film revolves around a mystery of missing gold.

Oscars 2026 nominations: Check out when and where to watch live in India The much-anticipated Oscars 2026 nominations will be announced on January 22, 2026. Here are the details about when and where to watch the 98th Academy Award announcement live in India.

O' Romeo: Vishal Bhardwaj on not seeking consent of Hussain Ustara's family Vishal Bhardwaj addressed controversy over O'Romeo's claim of being based on true events. The director clarified the film is a fictionalised narrative inspired by a published book, amid legal demands from the gangster's family.

Sudha Kongara wanted Abhishek Bachchan, Vijay Devarakonda cameos for Parasakthi Director Sudha Kongara revealed her process behind selecting cameo roles in Parasakthi and details her approach, including attempts to involve Abhishek Bachchan and Vijay Deverakonda.

general news.headline: Bengaluru airport staff molests Korean tourist on pretext of checking bagThe incident allegedly occurred on January 19, after the woman had completed immigration formalities and was approached by the accused, identified as Afan Ahmed, who claimed he needed to conduct a baggage inspection.

IAS officer at centre of stadium dog-walking row is new MCD commissionerSanjeev Khirwar, a 1994-batch IAS officer, was transferred to Ladakh in 2022 after causing a massive row by allegedly emptying Delhi's Thyagraj Stadium to walk his dog.

Trump drops Greenland tariff threat after talks with Nato chief on future deal  Live UpdatesUS President Donald Trump said the proposed Greenland framework would be good for both America and its Nato allies. He added that talks were continuing on the "Golden Dome" related to the Arctic territory.

Carney's hollow revolt: Canada talks of middle power after decades with superpowerAt Davos, Canadian PM Mark Carney was right in saying the old order is broken. But Canada cannot pretend it was merely a bystander to the making of American hegemony. Having prospered as the US' closest ally for decades, Ottawa now wants to lead a middle-power bloc. Isn't that off the Mark?

Time, Tide & Tamil Part 16 | Vaishnavism: The Ultimate Synthesis & Poetic PeakIf the Saivite revival was the fierce, indigenous gust that broke the cold austerity of Jain-Buddhist asceticism, the Vaishnavite tradition was the gentle, yet profound force that perfected the shift.

Tech flaws plagued Air India Boeing 787 long before Ahmedabad crash: US NGOAhmedabad Air India Crash: The group has now called for increased scrutiny of possible underlying technical faults, arguing that an emphasis on pilot actions may divert attention from deeper, underlying systemic issues.

Gambhir's sharp response on X has triggered a massive debate on social media.

Video: Locals swoop in to rescue IAF pilots after plane crashed in PrayagrajIt was a close shave for two Indian Air Force (IAF) pilots after their microlight aircraft crash-landed in Prayagraj following a technical malfunction on Tuesday.

To stay in Trump's good books? Pak faces backlash over Gaza Peace Board entryPakistan's entry into President Donald Trump's Gaza Peace Board has triggered domestic criticism, with opposition leaders warning the initiative sidelines Palestinian self-rule and risks weakening the United Nations' role globally.

Trump claims Russia agreed to join Peace Board, Putin says there's a riderPutin said Moscow is still consulting partners before deciding on joining the US-proposed Board of Peace for Gaza, contradicting US President Donald Trump's claim that Russia has already agreed to participate.

What the hell happened: Trump takes a jab at Macron's 'Top Gun' shades at DavosSpeaking at the World Economic Forum in Davos on Wednesday, Trump took a characteristically blunt yet curious swipe at Macron, referring to the French leader's much-discussed sunglasses. Here is what he said...

This brings back the old debate over the differing rules for cinema and digital platforms, and the effectiveness of censorship.
Is luxury nannying the new Gen Z career move?Moving away from traditional jobs, Gen Z is choosing a new career path, luxury nannying, which is said to offer more benefits than many corporate roles.

PM Modi saw the Trump trap coming. Other leaders didn'tEurope learnt it the hard way that trade agreements and flattery do not insulate even close allies from Trump's tariffs. Prime Minister Narendra Modi read the US President right months ahead and helped India avoid the Trump trap. The world should take note.

Caught on CCTV: Delhi man chased down street, stabbed to death in broad daylightThe victim was chased by four to five knife-wielding men, caught while trying to take refuge in a nearby house, dragged into the street and stabbed multiple times as bystanders watched without intervening.

Maha puzzle: Shinde Sena-MNS tie-up derails BJP's mayor bid in KalyanIn Kalyan-Dombivli, the Eknath Shinde-led Shiv Sena kept aside its bitter rivalry with Raj Thackeray's Maharashtra Navnirman Sena (MNS) to stitch up an alliance to prevent the BJP from securing the mayor's post.

CCTV trail shows last moments of Noida techie before drowning in water-filled pitAajtak accesses the complete chronology of the movements of Noida techie Yuvraj Mehta on the day his car plunged into the water-filled pit in Greater Noida. Here is a minute-by-minute timeline to show what happened after he left office. Read here....

Can India become the world's third-largest economy?At Davos, a session moderated by India Today Group Vice-Chairperson and Executive Editor-in-Chief Kalli Purie brought together leading economist Gita Gopinath, Union Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw, Bharti Chairman Sunil Bharti Mittal, and IKEA Group CEO Juvencio Maeztu Herrera to decode India's journey towards becoming the world's third-largest economy.

Bangladesh to decide on T20 World Cup participation after meeting cricketersThe Bangladesh government will take a call on T20 World Cup participation in a cabinet meeting on Thursday, January 22. The sports advisor will also meet the cricketers and take their opinion on participation in the World Cup.

Vlogger gives a sneak-peek of Vande Bharat first class, calls it '5 star on wheels'A video by vlogger Yash Bajpai offers a look inside India's first Vande Bharat sleeper train, which launched service between Howrah and Guwahati.

Trump drops Europe tariff threat but what did he agree on Greenland?Under a proposed deal agreed at the World Economic Forum, the United States would take control of parts of Greenland by designating them as sovereign base areas, allowing American military installations there to be treated as US territory.

An Autumn Davos in India? Ashwini Vaishnaw flags new idea at WEFUnderscoring the growing global recognition of India's economic reforms and investment momentum, Union Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw pitched for an 'Autumn Davos' at the World Economic Forum (WEF).

sports.headline: Rinku Singh underused by India, should have played 100 T20Is by now: Simon Doull IND vs NZ, 1st T20I: Rinku Singh's unbeaten 44 helped India crush New Zealand by 48 runs in Nagpur, prompting Simon Doull to call him one of the best finishers India has underutilized.

Decoding RCB's bold moves: Turning weakness into winning weapons in WPL 2026 WPL 2026: RCB have won five matches on the trot and sit atop the points table. With a playoff spot already secured, their focus now shifts to holding on to the top position and booking a direct berth in the final.

Barcelona, Bayern and Liverpool return to form as UCL RO16 race tightens Europe's heavyweights responded as the Champions League playoff race intensified, with Barcelona, Bayern Munich and Liverpool returning to winning ways. Crucial victories reshaped the qualification picture as margins tightened across the league phase.

IND vs NZ: Arshdeep Singh unfazed by Playing XI pressure, enjoying one game at a time Arshdeep Singh played down any Playing XI pressure after India's dominant Nagpur win, insisting his focus remains on enjoying the game and being ready whenever called upon. The left-arm pacer reiterated that selection decisions are beyond his control as India build towards the T20 World Cup.

AUS Open Day 5 live: Djokovic wins Set 1 vs Maestrelli, Sinner up next Australian Open 2026 Live: Novak Djokovic stamped his authority on Day 5, powering through the opening set 6–3 against Francesco Maestrelli at Rod Laver Arena. Jannik Sinner and Iga Swiatek will also take the court later on this star-studded schedule.

Gambhir reacts to Tharoor's PM Modi post, says pitted against his own team IND vs NZ: India head coach Gautam Gambhir found himself in the spotlight after Shashi Tharoor publicly lauded his role ahead of the New Zealand series. Gambhir's sharp response on X has triggered a massive debate on social media.

Abhishek Sharma jokes after Nagpur carnage: I don't have a lot of shots IND vs NZ: India opener Abhishek Sharma joked at the end of the 1st T20I that he did not have enough shots in his arsenal. Sharma said that he only had a few, and he tried to execute them well.

Bangladesh to decide on T20 World Cup participation after meeting cricketers The Bangladesh government will take a call on T20 World Cup participation in a cabinet meeting on Thursday, January 22. The sports advisor will also meet the cricketers and take their opinion on participation in the World Cup.

India crush New Zealand in Nagpur, begin final T20 World Cup preps in style IND vs NZ, 1st T20I: Suryakumar Yadav's India took a 1-0 lead in the five-match series after hammering New Zealand by 48 runs at the VCA Stadium in Nagpur. Abhishek Sharma was the star performer for the hosts with 84 runs off 35 balls.

Suryakumar Yadav shows signs of form, becomes 3rd fastest Indian to 9000 T20 runs IND vs NZ, 1st T20I: Suryakumar Yadav showed signs of returning to form, becoming the third-fastest Indian to 9,000 T20 runs with a fluent 32 off 22 balls against New Zealand on Wednesday in Nagpur.

Abhishek Sharma dazzles Nagpur with 35-ball 84, completes 5000 T20 runs Star India opener Abhishek Sharma lit up Nagpur with a blazing 35-ball 84 in the first T20I against New Zealand on Wednesday and became the fourth-fastest Indian batter to cross 5000 runs in T20 cricket.

Didn't stop Rohit Sharma for selfie: Woman explains shocking security breach in IndoreA woman breached security at the Indian team hotel in Indore on Sunday in an attempt to meet Rohit Sharma following India's ODI series against New Zealand. She later revealed that her actions were driven by a desperate effort to draw the Indian cricketer's attention and seek help for her ailing daughter.

Gambhir has hardest job after PM Modi, says Shashi Tharoor after meeting coachSenior Congress MP Shashi Tharoor on Wednesday met Indian men's cricket team head coach Gautam Gambhir, hailing him as "the man with the hardest job in India after the Prime Minister."

Day 5 Order of Play: Djokovic, Sinner, Swiatek aim for Round 3 berthsDay 5 of the Australian Open 2026 features Novak Djokovic, Jannik Sinner and Iga Swiatek headlining a blockbuster schedule as they aim to book their spots in the third round across Melbourne Park.

RCB need to decide on returning to Chinnaswamy stadium for IPL 2026: Venkatesh PrasadKSCA president Venkatesh Prasad says the ball is now in RCB's court on returning to Chinnaswamy for IPL 2026, assuring the stadium will be completely safe and ready after major upgrades.

IND vs NZ, 1st T20I: No Kuldeep Yadav, Ishan Kishan returns after over two yearsIND vs NZ, 1st T20I Playing XIs: New Zealand opted to bowl after winning the toss in the first T20I against India, handing Kristian Clarke a debut, while India recalled Ishan Kishan and left out Kuldeep Yadav and Shreyas Iyer.

ICC says no credible threat to safety of Bangladesh team in IndiaT20 World Cup 2026: The International Cricket Council on Wednesday dismissed Bangladesh's concerns over security in India, saying it's not feasible to change the venues in the eleventh hour. Bangladesh have remained adamant about not playing in India with all four of their league games scheduled across two cities in India.

Waugh, Maxwell open up on ODI cricket's future: Would hate to see it disappearSteve Waugh and Glenn Maxwell have expressed concerns over the future of ODI cricket amid the rapid growth of T20 leagues. Both Waugh and Maxwell are part of the inaugural European T20 Premier League.

Drop Babar Azam if you want to win BBL: Mark Waugh urges Sydney Sixers for tough loveFormer Australian all-rounder Mark Waugh has urged the Sydney Sixers to drop Babar Azam and reshuffle their batting to boost their title chances in the Big Bash League 2025-26.

Rohit Sharma opens up on tough calls he took as India captain: Can't please everyoneRohit Sharma has opened up on the hardest decisions of his captaincy, from leaving out Shreyas Iyer in 2022 to managing difficult conversations with senior players, explaining why leadership in Indian cricket means accepting that you cannot please everyone.

ICC votes to replace Bangladesh with Scotland if it doesn't play in IndiaT20 World Cup: The ICC has told the Bangladesh Cricket Board (BCB) to inform the Bangladesh government that if the team continues to refuse to travel to India for the 2026 T20 World Cup, it will be replaced by another side.

RCB get huge boost as star all-rounder joins squad before WPL 2026 playoffsRoyal Challengers Bengaluru have received a timely boost ahead of the WPL 2026 playoffs with the return of all-rounder Pooja Vastrakar, adding depth and experience to their squad.

Harry Brook admits fear of losing England captaincy after nightclub incidentEngland captain Harry Brook has revealed that the fear of losing his job was real after the nightclub incident, admitting the mistake weighed heavily on him and prompted a heartfelt apology to teammates, fans and the ECB.

1st T20I Highlights: India win by 48 runs, take 1-0 series leadIndia (IND) vs New Zealand (NZ) Highlights: A comprehensive all-round show saw Abhishek Sharma's fifty and Rinku Singh's late blitz set the tone, before Arshdeep and Hardik struck early and India closed out a comfortable 48-run win with authority.

IPL 2026: Kolkata Knight Riders appoint Dishant Yagnik as fielding coachIPL 2026: Kolkata Knight Riders appoint Dishant Yagnik as fielding coach ahead of IPL 2026, strengthening a star-studded support staff and completing a major rebuild after an aggressive auction.

Charith Asalanka returns as captain: Sri Lanka name 15-man squad for England ODIsSL vs ENG: Charith Asalanka returns as Sri Lanka captain for the England ODI series, with Dhananjaya de Silva recalled and several senior pacers missing as Colombo hosts all three matches.

Carlos Nadal: Alcaraz all smiles as fan's gesture wins heart in Australian OpenAustralian Open: Carlos Alcaraz lit up Rod Laver Arena with both his tennis and his personality, playfully responding to a playful "Carlos Nadal" shout from the stands before cruising past Yannick Hanfmann in straight sets.

Suryakumar Yadav given golden advice by former opener ahead of T20 World CupFormer India opener Aakash Chopra has given key advice to captain Suryakumar Yadav amid his poor T20I form. Chopra urges him to play straighter shots and spend more time at the crease ahead of the T20 World Cup 2026.

Pakistan offers to host Bangladesh's T20 World Cup games: ReportThe Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) has reportedly offered to host Bangladesh's T20 World Cup matches while backing its refusal to play the tournament in India.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
